reviews.review_content:
Ana was a great teacher for my first year of Spanish.  She was very patient and clearly knows how to teach Spanish well.  She is also fun and lively almost every day (everyone has slow days, but I never remember Ana being negative or unfair).  As another reviewer said, she is very lenient with late work, and I don't think she assigns much at all.  She'll love you as long as you put in some energy. I learned a lot and think she is a great asset to the Spanish department.  
Workload:
Light, and deadlines are lenient.  Departmental midterms and finals.

Overall a thorough and helpful professor. She isn't giving out any bonus points though, that's for sure. I would recommend her, as she can be there for you and she really goes through all the grammar. She is also lenient on a late assignment or a missed class.  
Workload:
medium homework, etc, all the same as for any other spanish class
